meanings.definition: The plural form of 'pollex', meaning the thumb.
meanings.sent1: She used her pollices to firmly grip the pencil.
meanings.sent2: He always sucks his pollices when he's nervous.
meanings.sent3: The kitten tried to catch the moving pollices of the clock.
meanings.sent4: Her pollices were like anchors, keeping her steady on the rocky path.
meanings.sent5: The pollices of the glove were worn out from constant use.

meanings.definition: The plural form of 'pollex', meaning the first digit of the hand.
meanings.sent1: The baby held onto her mother's pollices tightly.
meanings.sent2: He counted on his pollices to help him type quickly.
meanings.sent3: The magician made the coin disappear between his pollices.
meanings.sent4: The pollices of the clock pointed to midnight, signaling the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: Her pollices danced across the piano keys, creating beautiful music.
